name: Hanhaa
description: Hanhaa's product Parcelive, delivers insights, alerts and analytics from within the supply chain to all stakeholders. Creating a direct data relationship between the Parcel and the owners agnostic of the carrier anywhere in the world, we deliver a brand new capability to the industry. This Truth at Scale empowers Dispute resolution; Customer service and Network optimisation.

jobs.title: Operations Executive (Supply Chain & Logistics)
jobs.description:
Reporting to the Head of Operations, the role of the Operations Executive (Supply Chain & Logistics) is responsible for end-to-end supply chain activities of the Hanhaa global services, including but not limited to purchasing and logistics. The main goal is to support the Operations team to achieve the business plan objectives. Candidates must be flexible to do various tasks in a tech start-up environment.

Responsibilities

- Manage manufacturing and global purchasing, including but not limited to parts, packaging, equipment
- Manage the end to end logistics across the world, such as outbound and inbound/return logistics of the trackers, movement of stock and parts
- Maintain and develop new and existing supplier relationships
- Manage Hanhaa inventory levels across all sites, both internal and external sites
- Help implement industry recognised practice standards in Hanhaa
- Keep operational documents up to date
- Support projects implementation
- Support fulfilment operations
- Help review operational process and improve efficiency and effectiveness across the business, including but not limited to supply chain and logistics processes and materials
- Support the fulfilment process when it is required
- Some light manual work may be required occasionally

Key Attributes

- Excellent communication skills with the ability to interact with both internal and external parties
- Good team player
- Determination and resilience in problem-solving
- Flexible and strong willingness to learn and help
- PC literate with Microsoft Excel and Word skills
- Working knowledge of ERP systems
- Ability to manage multiple projects, tasks and stakeholders at the same time
- Work experience in the supply chain and logistics function of a technology/start-up company would be advantageous

jobs.title: SEO Specialist / Marketing Executive
jobs.description:
Hanhaa - Delivering Truth at Scale

We are looking for a smart, data-drivenSEO enthusiast to work on all aspects of SEO including content strategy, linkbuilding, keyword analysis, and conversion optimisation. You will play acentral part of driving business growth through SEO. We’re focusing on organic SEO and PPC.

This role is a springboard for you to grow your SEO skills through hands-on projects.

About us:
Hanhaa is an internet-of-things innovator. Our first integrated solution, ParceLive, is a real-time parcel tracking service that connects users to live information about the location, condition and security of their assets regardless of their country, carrier or scale.

ParceLive is being deployed internationally by leading logistics vendors and channel partners, and is now available directly to end-users wanting more control over the security of their assets.

Parent Company: Avnet

Typical responsibilities:
- Define the SEO Strategy across portfolio and create a blue print on the approach
- Identify the best keywords to drive the most valuable traffic
- Use tools like Google Analytics, SEMrush, Excel, Search Console, Ahrefs (or any preferred platform)
- Optimise per visit value and conversion rate
- Develop link building strategies
- Help create valuable content which attracts links
- Direct and manage content creation for long-tail keywords
- Plan and implement split tests

…plus whatever you think will grow revenue. This can be your SEO role to shape!

Requirements:
- Prior experience of successful SEO, digital marketing, or content marketing (even if it’s just from hobby sites)
- Ability to think analytically
- Excellent communication skills
- Desire to succeed

Added credit given to people with:
- Photoshop skills

Benefits:
- Profit sharing/share options
- Flexible working hours
- Free gym access 

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: £25,000.00 to £30,000.00 /year
